member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.ColorHalftoneCommand
member.summary: Shows the effect of using an enlarged halftone screen on each image channel. The filter divides the image into rectangles and replaces each rectangle with circles. Each channel has a separate grid of circles, and has its own angle setting. The size of each circle is proportional to the brightness of the rectangle that it is replacing. This method is available in the Document/Medical toolkits.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags
member.summary: Enumeration that indicates the treatment of the source, treatment of the destination, the operation to use when combining the data, and the treatment of the resulting image. The flags apply only to the defined rectangles (not necessarily the whole image).This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.ResultMaster
member.summary: Perform the operation on all channels.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.SourceNop
member.summary: No change.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.SourceMaster
member.summary: Perform the operation on all channels.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.DestinationMaster
member.summary: Perform the operation on all channels.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.DestinationNop
member.summary: No change.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationAnd
member.summary: Combine each set of bytes using a bitwise AND.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.ResultNop
member.summary: No change.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.SourceNot
member.summary: Invert the color, resulting in its complement.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.Source0
member.summary: Change all bits to 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.Source1
member.summary: Change all bits to 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.DestinationNot
member.summary: Invert the color, resulting in its complement.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.Destination0
member.summary: Change all bits to 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.Destination1
member.summary: Change all bits to 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationOr
member.summary: Combine each set of bytes using a bitwise OR.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.SourceCopy
member.summary: Copy source to destination.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationXor
member.summary: Combine each set of bytes using a bitwise exclusive OR (^).

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationAdd
member.summary: Add the byte values, allowing a maximum of 255.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationSubtractSource
member.summary: Subtract the source from the destination, allowing a minimum of 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationSubtractDestination
member.summary: Subtract the destination from the source, allowing a minimum of 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationMultiply
member.summary: Multiply the byte values, allowing a maximum of 255. The result is calculated as follows: result = (source * destination) / 255.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationDivideSource
member.summary: Divide the destination by the source. If source > 0, then the result is calculated as follows: result = min( (destination / source) * 255, 255 ). Otherwise, if source = 0, then result = 255.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationDivideDestination
member.summary: Divide the source by the destination. If dest > 0, then the result is calculated as follows: result = min( (source / destination) * 255, 255 ). Otherwise, if destination = 0, then result = 255.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationAverage
member.summary: Use the average of the two values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationMinimum
member.summary: Use the lesser of the two values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.OperationMaximum
member.summary: Use the greater of the two values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.AbsoluteDifference
member.summary: Calculate the Absolute difference between the two values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.ResultNot
member.summary: Invert the color, resulting in its complement.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.Result0
member.summary: Change all bits to 0.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.Result1
member.summary: Change all bits to 1.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.SourceRed
member.summary: Perform the operation on the red channel.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.SourceGreen
member.summary: Perform the operation on the green channel.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.SourceBlue
member.summary: Perform the operation on the blue channel.

member.summary: Perform the operation on the red channel.

member.summary: Perform the operation on the green channel.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.CombineCommandFlags.DestinationBlue
member.summary: Perform the operation on the blue channel.

member.summary: Perform the operation on the red channel.

member.summary: Perform the operation on the green channel.

member.name: T:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.FadedMaskCommandFlags
member.summary: Flags that indicate how the fade mask will be created.This enumeration has a FlagsAttribute attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.FadedMaskCommandFlags.None
member.summary: do nothing

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.FadedMaskCommandFlags.FadeOutsideRegion
member.summary: If this flag is set, the fade will be outside the image's region. If this flag is not set, the fade will be inside the image's region.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.FadedMaskCommandFlags.FillWithDumpColor
member.summary: If this flag is set, the dump part of the mask will be filled with the dump color. The DumpColorStart and FadeWhiteToBlack flags determine the dump color. If this flag is not set, the dump part is filled with the Transparent color.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.FadedMaskCommandFlags.DumpColorStart
member.summary: If this flag is set, the dump color is the color used at the start of the fade. The start color may be white or black, based on the FadeWhiteToBlack. If this flag is not set, the dump color is the color at the end of the fade. If the FillWithDumpColor flag is not set, this flag is ignored.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.FadedMaskCommandFlags.FadeWhiteToBlack
member.summary: If this flag is set, the fade starts with white and changes toward black. If this flag is not set, the fade changes from black to white.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.FadedMaskCommandFlags.NoTransparencyFill
member.summary: If this flag is set, fill the transparency part with a color other than Transparent. The color is either the same as the dump color, or its opposite, depending on whether the TransparencyAsDump flag is set. If the NoTransparencyFill flag is not set, fill the transparency with Transparent. If the FillWithDumpColor flag is not set, this flag is ignored.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.FadedMaskCommandFlags.TransparencyAsDump
member.summary: If this flag is set, the transparency color is the same as the dump color. If this flag is not set, the transparency color is the opposite of the dump color. This flag is used only if NoTransparencyFill is set.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.LaplacianFilter3
member.summary: Applies Laplacian line detection number 3. All pixels not on the detected lines are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.LaplacianDiagonal
member.summary: Applies diagonal Laplacian line detection. All pixels not on the detected lines are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.LaplacianHorizontal
member.summary: Applies horizontal Laplacian line detection. All pixels not on the detected lines are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.LaplacianVertical

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.SobelHorizontal
member.summary: Applies horizontal Sobel edge detection. All pixels not on the detected edges are changed to black. (The usage is the same as Prewitt, but the algorithm is different.)

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.SobelVertical
member.summary: Applies vertical Sobel edge detection. All pixels not on the detected edges are changed to black. (The usage is the same as Prewitt, but the algorithm is different.)

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.PrewittHorizontal
member.summary: Applies horizontal Prewitt edge detection. All pixels not on the detected edges are changed to black. (The usage is the same as Sobel, but the algorithm is different.) Choose the appropriate value for horizontal or vertical detection.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.PrewittVertical
member.summary: Applies vertical Prewitt edge detection. All pixels not on the detected edges are changed to black. (The usage is the same as Sobel, but the algorithm is different.) Choose the appropriate value for horizontal or vertical detection.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.ShiftAndDifferenceDiagonal
member.summary: Applies diagonal shift-and-difference edge detection. All pixels not on the detected edges are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.ShiftAndDifferenceHorizontal
member.summary: Applies horizontal shift-and-difference edge detection. All pixels not on the detected edges are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.ShiftAndDifferenceVertical
member.summary: Applies vertical shift-and-difference edge detection. All pixels not on the detected edges are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.LineSegmentHorizontal
member.summary: Applies horizontal line segment line detection. You can use this filter to find line discontinuities in an image. All pixels not on the detected line segments are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.LineSegmentVertical
member.summary: Applies vertical line segment line detection. You can use this filter to find line discontinuities in an image. All pixels not on the detected line segments are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.LineSegmentLeftToRight
member.summary: Applies left to right line segment line detection. You can use this filter to find line discontinuities in an image. All pixels not on the detected line segments are changed to black.

member.name: F:Leadtools.ImageProcessing.Effects.SpatialFilterCommandPredefined.LineSegmentRightToLeft
member.summary: Applies right to left line segment line detection. You can use this filter to find line discontinuities in an image. All pixels not on the detected line segments are changed to black.
